meanings.definition: To surpass or excel in riding or traveling on horseback.
meanings.sent1: She outrides all her friends in horseback riding skills.
meanings.sent2: He always outrides his competitors in the horse race.
meanings.sent3: The young girl outrides her fear of falling off the horse with a big smile.
meanings.sent4: His determination to outride any obstacles in his path is truly inspiring.
meanings.sent5: The image of the fearless knight outrides through the storm will stay with me forever.

meanings.definition: To ride faster or farther than someone else.
meanings.sent1: The champion jockey outrides the other racers with ease.
meanings.sent2: She always outrides her friends when they go on trail rides.
meanings.sent3: The horse outrides the wind, leaving a trail of dust behind.
meanings.sent4: His passion for outriding his own limits is truly remarkable.
meanings.sent5: The cheetah outrides any other animal in the savannah with its incredible speed.

meanings.sent1: They outride the town and explore the countryside on horseback.
meanings.sent2: The adventurous group outrides the usual trails and discovers a hidden waterfall.
meanings.sent3: The cowboy outrides the sunset, chasing the last rays of light.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams always outride the boundaries of reality.
meanings.sent5: The explorer outrides the map, venturing into uncharted territories.
